seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Tinkerfest Returns to the Amazeum This Month
posts.content:
Put your tinkering caps on and get ready for some fun during Tinkerfest ‚Äî the Amazeum‚Äôs celebration of tinkering, making, and creating on Saturday, Sep 23, from 10a-5p.

Hands-On Learning: Tinkerfest brings together craftspeople, educators, artists, engineers, scientists, and technologists from diverse backgrounds to interact with families, promote creativity and curiosity, and support a community of makers.

Tinker Together: Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or an avid tinkerer, join the fun! There will be hands-on activities for all ages, providing the perfect event for families to play, connect, create, and make.

Tickets go on sale tomorrow, Sep 9. Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Public Library Provides Rooms For Personal Study and Private Events
posts.content:
Whether you‚Äôre an event planner in need of a venue or a remote worker looking for a change of scenery, Fayetteville Public Library offers affordable event spaces and free study rooms.

Places to Work: Several meeting rooms and over 20 study rooms are available to reserve for up to 4 hours at a time ‚Äî perfect for a team meeting, tutoring sessions, or just a quiet space to work or study. Room reservations are free for library cardholders.

Places to Play: Event venues for medium to large-scale events are available at reasonable rates, including the Event Center (with a 1,000-person standing room capacity), multiple board rooms, a dance studio, a 16-station kitchen, and a beautiful outdoor courtyard space.

Visit faylib.org/reservations to book a room or faylib.org/rentals for more information about available event spaces.

posts.title: New Pub in Downtown Rogers Hosts Grand Opening
posts.content:
Pub on the Bricks launched last weekend in Downtown Rogers and will host its Grand Opening this weekend with live music by Blue Americana, performing Friday and Saturday, Sep 8-9.

A Family Affair: Located at The District, a newly renovated space at 106 W Elm St, Pub on the Bricks is owned by the Alexander family ‚Äî longtime residents of Rogers and founders of the annual Pig Gig Arkansas festival.

Grab a Pint: Come enjoy the laid-back vibes, craft brew delights, live music, and good times! The new venue has indoor and outdoor seating and a finely curated selection of 14 Arkansas craft beers on tap, as well as a handpicked assortment of wines and domestic beers.

Follow Pub on the Bricks for updates HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday, Northwest Arkansas! Here‚Äôs a snapshot of some exciting things happening around town this weekend. ¬†

üè† Hospitality: Join community partners & supporters for the official launch of Welcoming Week NWA 2023 at the Jones Center on Friday, Sep 8, from 9-10:30a.

üçª¬†Business is Brewming: Explore local startups during the NWA Startup Crawl as they showcase their products and services alongside local breweries, art displays, food trucks, and live music from Grammy-nominated band Sister Hazel tonight, Sep 8, from 5-9p.

üèí¬†Ice Hogs: Arkansas Hockey Club opens the 2023-24 Season against OSU this weekend at the Jones Center. Puck drops at 7:30p tonight, Sep 8, and Saturday, Sep 9, at 3:15p

üêä See Ya Later: Celebrate TxAR House‚Äôs First Anniversary with one of their famous Smoked Whole Gators and Crab & Shrimp Boil! Including live music on Saturday, Sep 9, from 4-7p. Doors open at noon.

üìö A Real Page Turner: Looking to update your personal library but don‚Äôt want to break the bank? Mark your calendar for the NWA Book Swap at The Apollo in Downtown Springdale on Saturday, Sep 9, from 6-9p.

üßµ Sew Fun: Enjoy live music by Sons of Otis Malone, the delicious KDK‚Äôs Chicken and Waffles food truck, and quilt-related art activities during the 45th Annual Ozark Quilt Fair on Saturday, Sep 9, from 10a-2p.

üéµ¬†The Gift of Song: Crystal Bridges introduced its first-ever performance art exhibit, Sonic Blossom, this week. Catch the musical performance installation on its first weekend.

üåÆ¬†Rolling Taco: The 4th Annual Tour de Tacos rolls out from JUNK Brands in Bentonville this Saturday, Sep 9, bringing riders together around the love of cycling and food for a great cause! Day-of-registration opens at 6a.

üé∏¬†Concert Weather: The Live on the Green concert series at the Momentary kicks off this weekend with indie-rock stars Alvvays, joined by special guest Julia Jacklin this Saturday, Sep 9.

üê∂¬†Dog Days: Get in the spirit of the school season with Best Friends' Bark to School Bash at the Pet Resource Center in Bentonville this Saturday, Sep 9, from 10a-4p!

üêó¬†Call the Hogs: Stroll through the free, family-friendly HogTown celebration before the Razorbacks take on Kent State, including food trucks, a beer garden, giveaways, and live music with indie soul and rock n' roll group The Cole Birmingham Band on Saturday, Sep 9.

üåé Around the World: The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will celebrate the many cultures that make up the Northwest Arkansas community during the 7th Annual International Festival this Sunday, Sep 10, from 3-7p.

üé§¬†Mic‚Äôd Up: Explore the local live music scene with the Stages.Live App and find shows happening around town this weekend.

Enjoy your weekend! See you back here on Monday.

posts.title: Celebrate Big Brothers Big Sisters at the BIG Event
posts.content:
Celebrate the work of Big Brothers Big Sisters NWA during the annual BIG Event, taking place at Osage House in Cave Springs on Thursday, Sep 14, at 6p.

Role Model: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northwest Arkansas inspires the potential of youth by organizing one-to-one mentoring relationships that contribute to social and emotional development. The annual BIG Event celebrates the impact that BBBS makes in NWA and showcases the influence that our Bigs have in the community.

Big Time: Join the celebration and see who gets named Big & Little of the Year. This is a great opportunity to network with community leaders and learn how to get involved with BBBS. There will be an open bar, a sit-down dinner, and a silent/live auction.

Learn more and reserve your seat at the BIG Event HERE.

posts.title: Race Through The Woods During the Here‚Äôs Johnny 10K Trail Run
posts.content:
Tap into your inner Jack Torrance during the inaugural Here‚Äôs Johnny 10k trail run at Coler Mountain Bike Preserve on Saturday, Oct 7.

All Work, No Play: The Here's Johnny 10k will feature technical trails for those looking to take the next step in trail running. Racers will navigate the eerie woods of Coler Mountain Bike Preserve, starting in the misty valley and weaving through parts of the Here‚Äôs Johnny trail before returning to The Homestead.

Shining Performance: All racers will receive a special-edition finisher medal and t-shirt. Awards will be given out to the top overall runners as well as the top 3 in each age group. Sign up by Sep 14 to guarantee your t-shirt size.

Race entry is $40. Register to run HERE.

posts.title: #NWAChampionship Week Tickets On Sale Now
posts.content:
The Walmart NW Arkansas Championship, presented by P&G, returns Sep 23 ‚Äì Oct 1 to Pinnacle Country Club, bringing an exciting week of events to the region.

On the Run: The #NWAChampionship Week will once again feature a variety of community-driven events and experiences, including the 5k @ the LPGA benefiting Mercy and an enhanced onsite area for families ‚Äî the Walmart and P&G Kids Confidence Club.

Razorback Red: Tournament officials are thrilled to announce that the field will include a robust lineup of current and former Arkansas Razorback student-athletes, including Brooke Matthews and Miriam Ayora, who both have received exemptions to compete in the event.

Tournament tickets and the full schedule of events are available at NWAChampionship.com.

posts.title: Explore the Flavors of Northwest Arkansas During the 4th Annual Tour De Tacos
posts.content:
The 4th Annual Tour de Tacos starts rolling this Saturday, Sep 9, bringing riders together around the love of cycling and food for a great cause!

Support: All rides start and finish at JUNK Brands in Bentonville and benefit women and families seeking economic independence through Dress for Success. Day-of-event registration will open at 6a on Saturday, so the last-minute tacos enthusiasts can still get in on the fun!

Taco ‚Äôbout Fun: Tour de Tacos includes 62, 30, and 7-mile bike rides along the Razorback Greenway, with restaurants and businesses set up along the path to provide cyclists food and hydration. A Block Party will be set up at the finish line, where you can enjoy taco vendors, drinks, live music, and community booths.

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Take a Tour Around the World at the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks
posts.content:
The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will celebrate the many cultures that make up the Northwest Arkansas community during the 7th Annual International Festival this Sunday, Sep 10, from 3-7p.

Come One, Come All: In conjunction with Welcoming Week NWA (Sep 8-17) ‚Äî a series of events bringing together immigrants, refugees, and native-born residents to encourage inclusivity and collective prosperity. Experts will be present, sharing about resources for immigrants, refugees, and other marginalized communities.

Global Garden: Bring your picnic blankets and lawn chairs and enjoy dinner from one of several food truck vendors while witnessing traditional dances and musical performances on the Great Lawn. Take a stroll around the Garden and explore booths featuring arts and crafts, displays, and cultural items for sale.

The event is free, but you need to register online HERE.

posts.title: K1 Speed Announces Indoor Go-Kart Center for Rogers
posts.content:
Add an indoor go-kart center to the list of exciting developments in Northwest Arkansas. K1 Speed recently announced plans to open an entertainment center in Rogers.

Mr. Worldwide: K1 Speed has over 72 locations worldwide, offering high-speed electric go-kart racing. Dates for the Rogers location have not yet been announced.

Party On: The¬†entertainment center will feature an electric go-kart race track, an arcade, pool tables, air hockey, and a restaurant, making it a great place to host birthdays, bachelor parties, company parties, and more.

Learn more about the Rogers location and receive updates HERE.

posts.title: Explore Local Businesses and Breweries During the NWA Startup Crawl
posts.content:
The best and brightest of Northwest Arkansas's dynamic entrepreneurial scene will showcase their products and services alongside local breweries, art displays, food trucks, and live music during the NWA Startup Crawl this Friday, Sep 8, at 5p.

Start Strong: Organized by local nonprofit Startup Junkie, the NWA Startup Crawl draws hundreds of attendees each year, from investors and business leaders to students and entrepreneurs who want to support and learn from each other.

All for You: Each startup will be paired with a local brewery, and crawlers who visit all ten official stops will receive a shirt and be entered to win an iPad. This year‚Äôs exciting musical lineup includes country group Midnight South, pop duo joan, and the Grammy-nominated chart-toppers Sister Hazel.

Ticket sales end soon. Reserve your spot HERE.

posts.title: Welcoming Week NWA Highlights the Region‚Äôs Cultural Diversity
posts.content:
Welcoming Week NWA 2023 will take place Sep 8-17, bringing a week full of community events, multiple speaker panels, volunteer drives, and ways to highlight the importance of making NWA a thriving and inclusive place to live and work.

Hospitality: Welcoming Week NWA begins with an Opening Celebration at the Jones Center this Friday, Sep 8, from 9-11a, featuring keynote speaker Victor Calise ‚Äî Walmart Director of Global DEI, Paralympian, and advocate for adapting spaces for those with disabilities.

Making Waves: The Arkansas Coalition of Marshallese will also highlight an upcoming cultural training, and the Ocean Wave dancers will perform traditional dances from the Pacific Islands.

See a full schedule of Welcoming Week NWA events HERE.

posts.title: Best Friends Hosts Bark to School Bash at Pet Resource Center
posts.content:
Get in the spirit of the school season with Best Friends' Bark to School Bash at the Pet Resource Center in Bentonville this Saturday, Sep 9, from 10a-4p!

State of the Bark: If you haven't been to the state-of-the-art Pet Resource Center yet, now‚Äôs your chance! Grab a drink from Third Space Coffee, play with kittens, take a slide downstairs to visit the pups, and meet the team working to make Arkansas shelters no-kill by 2025.

Doggone Fun: Meet dogs from Best Friends and other area shelters during the Adoptable Dog Fair from 10a-1p, and enjoy plenty of fun activities throughout the day, like face painting, balloon animals, paint and plant your own catnip pot activity, storytime in the kitten room, a make-your-own dog treat station, and more!

Find more Bark to School details HERE.
posts.topic: Sponsored by Best Friends Animal Society

posts.title: Lose Yourself in the Music with Alvvays at the Momentary This Weekend!
posts.content:
Discover your next musical obsession with the Live on the Green concert series at the Momentary! The fall vibes kick off this weekend with indie-rock stars Alvvays, joined by special guest Julia Jacklin this Saturday, Sep 9.

Dreams Tonite: Described by The New York Times as ‚Äúan indie-rock band that wraps fuzzy layers of rock instrumentation around stories of hard lives and hurt feelings,‚Äù Alvvays combines sober songwriting with vibrant, dream-like melodies.

On the Green: Bring your folding chairs and blankets and enjoy the fall evening to the sound of live music on the Momentary Green. Grab a bite at the Momentary Food Truck and a fun beverage from the R√òDE Bar before and during the show!

Get your tickets today at theMomentary.org/Music

posts.title: Get Folky During This Month‚Äôs Fayetteville First Thursday
posts.content:
Fayetteville‚Äôs First Thursday theme this month is First Folksday, celebrating Ozark folklife of the past, present, and future and featuring traditional handicrafts, history, and musical performances on the Downtown Square Sep 7, from 5:30-9p.

Chill Folks: First Thursday on the Square is an annual event series by Experience Fayetteville intended to gather the community around the combination of music, food, art, and fun! This month‚Äôs entertainment will feature Carousel Orchestra, Ozark Free Music Society, and headliner Kory McKelvy & Band.

Hill Folks: Several local culture and heritage organizations, including Ozark Folkways, the University of Arkansas Museum, and the Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, will present demonstrations and displays. Artists Matthew McMillan and Bryce Arroyos will create a quilt-inspired large-scale canopy above the Fayetteville Town Center Plaza.

Find all the details about Fayetteville's First Thursday HERE.

posts.title: Arts & Culture Monthly Spotlight
posts.content:
Stay up to date with Northwest Arkansas‚Äôs vibrant arts & culture scene with the Arkansas Creative Calendar from CACHE. Here are a few events we‚Äôre excited about this September:

Update your library without breaking the bank during the NWA Book Swap at The Apollo in Downtown Springdale this Saturday, Sep 9, from 6-9p.

From art crawls and comedy shows to vendor fairs and a Monarch Butterfly Parade, Downtown Springdale‚Äôs ART WALK has something for everyone to enjoy on Sep 14-15.

In conjunction with NWA Welcoming Week, the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will host its 7th Annual International Festival on Sep 10, from 3-7p, celebrating the numerous cultures that make up the Northwest Arkansas community!

City Sessions hosts its first-ever fundraiser show this month, featuring hometown artists Baang and Kyle Jackson and an exciting headliner performance by JOSEPH on Sep 16.

Back for its second year, FORMAT Festival will bring a dynamic weekend of music, arts, and technology to Bentonville the weekend of Sep 22-24, with a stacked 2023 lineup including LCD Soundsystem, Leon Bridges, and Alanis Morissette.

Find other regional Arts & Culture events HERE.

posts.title: Chile Pepper Cross Country Festival Celebrates 35 Years and A Major Philanthropic Milestone
posts.content:
The 2023 Chile Pepper Cross Country Festival will take off Sep 29-30 ‚Äî marking the renowned festival‚Äôs 35th year and a landmark year for its philanthropic efforts.

Cross Country: One of America‚Äôs premiere running events, the festival brings together local and national runners for a weekend of spirited competition at the University of Arkansas Agriculture Fields Complex

A Million Miles: Since 1988, the festival has supported the region‚Äôs high school cross-country programs, and as the festival rings in its 35th year, the collective contributions are expected to surpass $1m, marking a significant milestone for the festival's history.

The cost of registration goes up tomorrow, so sign up today HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Pedals into Cycle September
posts.content:
Cycle September kicked off over the weekend with people all over Northwest Arkansas joining in the annual global challenge to log some serious miles on their bikes.

Set goals: Organizations are using the Love to Ride platform to encourage a more sustainable, healthy, and active lifestyle. Through Love to Ride, individuals or groups can set goals to achieve by the end of the month.

Go the Distance: Whether riding recreationally or for transportation, anyone can participate. Indoor stationary biking counts as well! So, join in on Cycle September, challenge yourself, and take part in some friendly competition. You could very well win a prize!

Learn more HERE.
